text:
- I studied political
science for my undergraduate

and then, I moved into
international affairs
for my master's program.
So, I've always wanted to be in tech,
but I was a bit scared.

My first contact with tech
was the AWS re/Start program.

The support from the community
that we had in the class,
and then the tutors

for the AWS re/Start
program was what helped me.

Right after graduating, I got
a role as a DevOps engineer,
and then, I became a cloud trainer.

And then, I am now
currently a product manager.
I came across AWS Educate on LinkedIn.

I love the practical aspects
and the labs that it came with.

I was able to get some
badges from AWS Educate,

and then I got invited into
the Emergent Talent Program,
and now, I'm a member of the community
with exciting opportunities,

exciting community to
learn from and all that.
It's been amazing

because of how gamified
the whole community is.
You do challenges to secure points.
It just pushes you to learn more.

What I really like about
it is the people aspect
that you get people to interact with you.

Anytime you have any
question, you're able to post.

People can give their
suggestions, their solutions.
AWS has changed my life in the sense
that getting me into the field of tech.
(bright upbeat music)
